intro: Lasianthus setosus, commonly known as the hairy lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
